privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.subtitle: Learn how Alfa Automations collects, uses, and protects your personal information when you use our AI automation platform services.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content: Alfa Automations ("Alfa Automations", "we", "us" or "our"), is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, store, and protect personal data when you use our services – including interacting with our AI automation platform, contacting us via email, or using our integrations with third-party services.

dataCollection.title: Data We Collect
dataCollection.intro: We only collect personal data that is necessary for the purposes described in this Policy, and we do so with appropriate notice or consent. The types of information we may collect include:

directInfo.title: Information You Provide Directly
directInfo.subtitle: When you interact with our AI automation platform or other channels, you may provide personal data such as:
items: Name, email address, phone number
Company information and job title
Communication preferences
Content of messages and interactions
Support requests and feedback

accountInfo.title: Account and Profile Information
accountInfo.subtitle: If our services require registration or integration via Google account:
items: Name, username, email address
Telegram ID or username (provided through Telegram platform)
Profile information needed for service provision

integrationData.title: Integrations Data
integrationData.subtitle: When you integrate with third-party platforms (Google services, HubSpot, Trello, etc.):
items: Calendar event details (if integrated with Google Calendar)
Contact information and task details (for CRM/project tools)
Data necessary for system updates and automation

usageData.title: Usage Data and Logs
items: Device/browser type, access times, IP address
Interaction logs (date/time of chatbot interactions)
Error logs and performance metrics
System monitoring data for maintenance and security

processingPurpose.title: Purpose and Legal Basis for Processing
processingPurpose.intro: We use the collected personal data for specific purposes and only where we have a legal basis under GDPR to do so:

serviceProvision.title: Providing and Improving Services
serviceProvision.legalBasis: Legal basis: Performance of contract, legitimate interests
items: Operate Telegram bots and related services
Respond to inquiries and carry out requested tasks
Generate appropriate responses and perform automated actions
Analyze usage patterns to enhance our services
Create support tickets or update records per your request

communications.title: Communications and Support
communications.legalBasis: Legal basis: Legitimate interest, performance of contract
items: Respond to customer support requests
Send service-related notifications and updates
Notify about changes to services or policies
Provide customer satisfaction and address user needs

integrations.title: Integrations and Automated Actions
items: Transfer data to/from third-party systems as requested
Create contacts in CRM or cards in project management tools
Process data through authorized integrations
Fulfill functionality requested by you or our clients

compliance.title: Compliance and Legal Obligations
compliance.legalBasis: Legal basis: Legal obligation, legitimate interest
items: Comply with legal obligations and reporting requirements
Respond to law enforcement requests
Keep records for accounting purposes
Exercise or defend legal claims

security.title: Security and Fraud Prevention
items: Monitor and ensure security of our services
Prevent abuse, fraud, or unauthorized access
Detect and address technical issues
Analyze logs to detect suspicious activity

dataSharing.title: Data Sharing and Third-Party Integrations
dataSharing.intro: We treat your personal data with care and do not sell or rent your information to third parties for their own marketing purposes. However, we may share personal data in the following circumstances:

serviceProviders.title: Service Providers and Partners
serviceProviders.subtitle: We use trusted third-party service providers to help us run our business:
items: Cloud Infrastructure: MongoDB Atlas and Hetzner Online servers for secure hosting
Automation Tools: n8n workflow automation platform for system connections
Third-Party APIs: HubSpot (CRM), Trello (project management), Google services
Analytics and Monitoring: Error tracking and performance monitoring services

businessClients.title: Business Clients (Controllers)
businessClients.subtitle: When we provide chatbot services to business clients, they may be the primary data controllers:
items: We act as data processor on behalf of the client
We process data only as instructed by the client
Clients are responsible for obtaining necessary consent from end-users
We ensure GDPR compliance through Data Processing Agreements

legalRequirements.title: Legal Requirements and Protection
legalRequirements.subtitle: We may disclose personal data if we believe it's necessary to:
items: Comply with legal obligations and valid legal processes
Respond to government authority requests
Protect rights, property, or security of Alfaliike, users, or public
Prevent or investigate wrongdoing, fraud, or security incidents

corporateTransactions.title: Corporate Transactions
corporateTransactions.content: If Alfaliike is involved in a merger, acquisition, or sale of assets, your personal data may be transferred. We will ensure confidentiality is maintained and provide notice before data becomes subject to a different privacy policy.

dataStorage.title: Data Storage and International Transfers

storageLocations.title: Storage Locations
storageLocations.intro: Your personal data is stored on secure servers and databases within the European Union:
items: MongoDB Atlas cloud database service (EU data centers)
Hetzner Online application servers (Germany/Finland)
High levels of encryption and security controls
Data residency options based on client requirements

internationalTransfers.title: International Transfers
internationalTransfers.intro: When personal data is transferred outside the EEA, we ensure adequate safeguards:
items: Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs): EU-approved data protection clauses
Data Processing Addendums: GDPR compliance commitments
Technical Measures: Encryption in transit and at rest (TLS/SSL)
Regionalization: Process data in region closest to users
Access Controls: Network protections and authorization systems

dataStorage.note: Note: Telegram Messenger Inc. and other third-party services process data under their own privacy policies as independent entities. We only partner with reputable, privacy-compliant services.

dataSecurity.title: Data Security
dataSecurity.intro: We take data security very seriously and employ a range of technical and organizational measures to safeguard your personal information:

technicalMeasures.title: Technical Security Measures
items: Encryption: TLS/SSL for data in transit, encrypted databases at rest
Network Security: Firewalls, secure network architectures, VPN access
Access Control (RBAC): Need-to-know basis, multi-factor authentication
Monitoring: Continuous system monitoring, security alerts, audit logs
Secure Infrastructure: 24/7 monitored data centers with physical security

organizationalMeasures.title: Organizational Measures
items: Staff confidentiality agreements and data protection training
Privacy by design and security by design approaches
Regular security testing, vulnerability scans, code reviews
Incident response plan with breach notification procedures

disclaimer.title: Security Disclaimer
disclaimer.content: While we implement industry-standard security measures, no method of transmission over the Internet is 100% secure. You transmit data to us at your own risk and should use secure networks and devices.

dataRetention.title: Data Retention
dataRetention.intro: We will retain personal data only for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this Policy, unless a longer retention period is required or permitted by law:

chatData.title: Chat Data
items: Conversation logs kept as long as needed to provide service
Retained for quality assurance and bot improvement (after anonymization)
Purged or anonymized after reasonable period when no longer actively needed

integrationData.title: Integration Data
items: Records in third-party systems subject to those systems' retention policies
Internal sync data treated like chat data
Retained only as needed for integration function

accountData.title: Account/Contact Data
items: Retained while we continue to interact with you or provide services
Deleted or anonymized upon consent withdrawal or service cessation
Basic contact records kept for administrative purposes as necessary

logsBackups.title: Logs and Backups
items: System logs typically retained for 30-90 days
Backup snapshots managed with expiration policies
Extended retention only if justified by security incidents or legal requirements

dataRetention.note: When we have no ongoing legitimate business need, we will delete, anonymize, or securely isolate your data. Residual copies in backup systems will be purged according to our backup retention schedule.

yourRights.title: Your Rights
yourRights.intro: As an individual whose personal data we process, especially if you are in the EU, you have certain data protection rights under GDPR:

accessInfo.title: Access and Information
items: Right of Access: Request confirmation and copy of your personal data
Information: Understand how we use your data and verify lawfulness

correction.title: Correction and Updates
items: Right to Rectification: Correct inaccurate or incomplete information
Updates: Keep your email, contact, and profile information current

deletion.title: Deletion and Restriction
items: Right to Erasure: "Right to be forgotten" when data no longer necessary
Right to Restrict Processing: Temporarily halt processing in certain circumstances
Objection Rights: Object to processing based on legitimate interests

portability.title: Portability and Consent
items: Data Portability: Receive your data in machine-readable format
Withdraw Consent: Stop consent-based processing at any time
Marketing Opt-out: Unconditional right to stop direct marketing

complaints.title: Complaints and Support
items: Supervisory Authority: Lodge complaints with data protection authorities
Finland: Office of the Data Protection Ombudsman (Tietosuojavaltuutetun toimisto)
Response Time: We respond within one month to rights requests

yourRights.note: To exercise your rights, contact us using the information below. We may need to verify your identity to process certain requests. Exercising your rights is free of charge except in cases of unfounded or excessive requests.

childrensPrivacy.title: Children's Privacy
childrensPrivacy.content1: Our services (including our Telegram bots and integrations) are not directed to children under the age of 16. We do not knowingly collect personal data from anyone under 16 years old.
childrensPrivacy.content2: If you are under 16, please do not use our services or provide any personal information. In the event we learn that we have inadvertently collected personal data from a child under 16 without appropriate consent, we will take steps to delete that information as soon as possible.
childrensPrivacy.content3: If you are a parent or guardian and discover that your child under 16 has engaged with our services and provided personal data, please contact us immediately, and we will promptly remove the child's information from our records.
childrensPrivacy.noteContent: In Finland, the age of consent for information society services is 13 for consent-based processing. However, our policy is to avoid providing services to minors altogether given the business-oriented nature of our bots. By using our services, you represent that you are at least 16 years old.

policyUpdates.title: Updates to This Policy
policyUpdates.intro: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices, technologies, legal requirements, or for other operational reasons.

notificationMethods.title: Notification Methods
items: Revising the "Effective Date" at the top of the Policy
Posting notices on our website for significant changes
Notifying users via bot or email for material changes
Providing prominent notice as required by law

consent.title: Your Consent
consent.content: Your continued use of our services after any changes to this Policy constitutes acceptance of the updated terms. We encourage you to review this Policy periodically to stay informed about how we are protecting your information.

policyUpdates.newPurpose: If we seek to use your personal data for a new purpose that is not compatible with the purposes for which we originally collected it, we will obtain your consent or provide you with a relevant notice as required by law.

cookies.title: Cookie
cookies.subtitle: Learn about how Alfa Automations uses cookies and similar technologies to enhance your experience and improve our AI automation platform.

notice.title: Cookie Notice
notice.content: This Cookie Policy explains how Alfa Automations and our partners use cookies and similar technologies when you visit our website or use our services. We are committed to transparency about how we collect and use your data.

whatAreCookies.title: What Are Cookies?
whatAreCookies.content: Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device when you visit a website. They are widely used to make websites work more efficiently, provide information to website owners, and enhance user experience.

session.title: Session Cookies
session.description: Temporary cookies that expire when you close your browser

persistent.title: Persistent Cookies
persistent.description: Cookies that remain on your device for a set period or until manually deleted

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Cookies
thirdParty.description: Set by external services we use

essential.title: Essential Cookies
essential.description: These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off. They enable core functionality such as security, network management, and accessibility.

performance.title: Performance Cookies
performance.description: These cookies help us understand how visitors interact with our website by collecting anonymous information about usage patterns.
examples: Page load times and performance metrics

functional.title: Functional Cookies
functional.description: These cookies enable enhanced functionality and personalization, such as remembering your preferences and settings.

marketing.title: Marketing Cookies
marketing.description: These cookies track your online activity to help advertisers deliver more relevant advertising or limit how many times you see an ad.

thirdPartyServices.title: Third-Party Services
thirdPartyServices.intro: We use trusted third-party services that may set their own cookies. These services help us provide and improve our platform:

managingCookies.title: Managing Your Cookie Preferences
managingCookies.intro: You have control over the cookies set on your device. Here's how you can manage them:

consentBanner.title: Cookie Consent Banner
consentBanner.description: When you first visit our website, you can choose which types of cookies to accept through our consent banner.

accountSettings.title: Account Settings
accountSettings.description: Registered users can manage cookie preferences in their account settings under Privacy & Cookies.

browserSettings.title: Browser Settings
browserSettings.description: You can control cookies through your browser settings. Note that disabling essential cookies may affect website functionality.

importantNote.title: Important Note
importantNote.content: Disabling certain cookies may limit your ability to use some features of our platform. Essential cookies cannot be disabled as they are required for basic functionality.

policyUpdates.title: Policy Updates
policyUpdates.content: We may update this Cookie Policy periodically to reflect changes in our practices or for legal compliance. We will notify you of any material changes through our website or email.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.intro: If you have any questions about this Cookie Policy or how we handle cookies, please contact us:
contact.responseTime: We aim to respond to all privacy-related inquiries within 5 business days.

helpCenter.subtitle: Find answers to frequently asked questions and get the support you need

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.description: Quick start guide and setup information

questions.question: How fast can we start?
questions.answer: We can deliver a working prototype within 48 hours after the initial briefing session. Our rapid development process allows you to see results quickly and iterate based on your feedback.

questions.question: Can we mix assistant types?
questions.answer: Yes—Personal, Business, and Group. Our platform supports multiple assistant types that can work together seamlessly, allowing you to create a comprehensive automation ecosystem tailored to different use cases and user groups.

questions.question: What does it cost?
questions.answer: Demo is free, business plans on request.

dataHosting.title: Data & Security
dataHosting.description: Information about data hosting, security, and compliance

questions.question: Where is data hosted?
questions.answer: All data is hosted in the EU using Hetzner infrastructure. We maintain strict access controls with comprehensive logging and monitoring enabled to ensure maximum security and compliance with GDPR regulations.

questions.question: Is my data secure?
questions.answer: Yes, your data is secure. All data is hosted in the EU using Hetzner infrastructure. We maintain strict access controls with comprehensive logging and monitoring enabled to ensure maximum security and compliance with GDPR regulations.

questions.question: Do we need Telegram?
questions.answer: Telegram is optimal for fast pilots and real-time communication, but it's not mandatory. We also support web widgets and email forms for customer interaction, giving you flexibility in how you engage with your users.

questions.question: Which systems do you integrate with?
questions.answer: We integrate with a wide range of systems including Google services (Sheets, Drive, Calendar), HubSpot CRM, Trello for project management, eBay APIs for e-commerce, custom Webhooks and APIs for bespoke solutions, and FastAPI for rapid development. We can also develop custom integrations based on your specific needs.

questions.question: Can you integrate other CRMs?
questions.answer: Yes—custom integration €199–€499 one-time. We can develop custom integrations for most CRM systems beyond our standard offerings. The cost depends on the complexity of the integration and specific requirements.

support.title: Support & SLA
support.description: Support options and service level agreements

questions.question: What support and SLA do you provide?
questions.answer: Support levels vary by plan. Our Enterprise plan includes an extended SLA with guaranteed response times, priority support, and dedicated account management. Standard plans include email support with regular business hours coverage.

questions.question: Can we self-host?
questions.answer: Available on Enterprise. Self-hosting options are included in our Enterprise plan, giving you complete control over your infrastructure and data while maintaining full platform functionality.
